comment.body:
> > but this script does include the src= which i believe i remember is the sourse so its an external javascript file right?
> 
> Yes.
> 
> https://adguard.com/kb/general/ad-filtering/create-own-filters/#basic-rules-special-characters - maybe possible use wildcards if some letters/numers are stable in `src="..."`.
> 
> If nope then needed is learn regex and what regex is now suported at iOS:
> 
> https://adguard.com/kb/general/ad-filtering/create-own-filters/#regexp-support

Why is everytime i report miss ads on the adguard website and create a ticket that ticket is just added into the previous ones i also made on the same thread?

Yes.

https://adguard.com/kb/general/ad-filtering/create-own-filters/#basic-rules-special-characters - maybe possible use wildcards if some letters/numers are stable in `src="..."`.

If nope then needed is learn regex and what regex is now suported at iOS:

https://adguard.com/kb/general/ad-filtering/create-own-filters/#regexp-support

comment.body:
There is nothing to understand there for now, just into the address bar paste one of the two:

`view-source:https://www3.zoechip.com/`
`view-source:http://zoechip.com/`

 and just start watching videos for "free" with open page now normally. The method will only work if they check by the IP of your network connection if this is your first visit to the site. You can try to check over Wi-Fi as you view this site more often on a "macbook"/iMac.

---
---

As the site needs to "bake" the "you've seen our ugly ads" cake, it's better to open it from a substitute such as: https://fiddle.jshell.net/9ngLtwx5/2/show/dark/

comment.body:
> try check:
> 
> `view-source:https://www3.zoechip.com/` `view-source:http://zoechip.com/`
> 
> maybe their exist latest inline redirect script.
> 
> You can see if this manages to block line scripts on the home page after 200 ms delay:
> 
> ```
> ||zoechip.com/|$inline-script,important
> ```
> 
> With that said, I don't keep track of whether inline-script has been added for iOS, then may works only:
> 
> ```
> ||zoechip.com/|$csp=script-src 'self' 'unsafe-eval' http: https: data: blob: mediastream: filesystem:,important
> ```
> 
> if `csp=` works on iOS.
> 
> As the site by IP injects inline JS, you can always open its source code at first and only then fire it normally.
> 
> If page "bake" cookies/localStorage, then maybe use this as homepage: https://fiddle.jshell.net/9ngLtwx5/2/show/dark/ = simple adware should not go back/outside at used iframe/object/embed.

I dont understand anything your saying i want to i want to learn i strive to learn but maybe im just too basic for this maybe im too dumb

issue.title: www3.zoechip.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www3.zoechip.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww3.zoechip.com) ### Comment Username: @olstice > > So I thought I had this resolved turns out it was only a temporary solution the website Zoechip has an imbeded head meta tag href link of which right now its https://zkwl.zwmvyzyrlvzew.top/kbwaazlzkwjla/abqaj > > before that it was https://krze.klrqqylrzzzj.top/kzzeenqvnqjww/abqaj > > the only connection both url have is the .top/abqaj everything else is different. > > And no matter which one i block of these rules ||zwmvyzyrlvzew.top^$important klrqqylrzzzj.top^$important ||qnlranvabrnq.top^$important > > A new one just gets added into the head meta tag section of the html making the rule no longer apply > > I issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.6

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers, Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www3.zoechip.com/movie/spirited-90331

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment> Hi so im going on zoechip3.org to try and watch a movie and even with my adguard up to date, latest version, and Mobil ads filter and base filter it still has ads on the site that i annoyingly have to keep closing only to open pop us which i have to close of those and if you click on the site it opens pop up tabs 

you literally have to face a couple pop up tabs to finally be able to use the site any help to this would be very appreciative 
3. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary> 

<!-- paste screenshot here [-->]
![9FF2E12D-81D9-490B-BD32-4AFDD2391307](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/124982114/c25f6f6e-ebe5-4057-9f41-4e813e605088)



</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary
![95476ADB-CCD6-4D17-83F5-5CEE56473FD7](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/124982114/24651f2c-81de-49ea-9afa-de81ac4976a1)
>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
> try check:
> 
> `view-source:https://www3.zoechip.com/` `view-source:http://zoechip.com/`
> 
> maybe their exist latest inline redirect script.
> 
> You can see if this manages to block line scripts on the home page after 200 ms delay:
> 
> ```
> ||zoechip.com/|$inline-script,important
> ```
> 
> With that said, I don't keep track of whether inline-script has been added for iOS, then may works only:
> 
> ```
> ||zoechip.com/|$csp=script-src 'self' 'unsafe-eval' http: https: data: blob: mediastream: filesystem:,important
> ```
> 
> if `csp=` works on iOS.
> 
> As the site by IP injects inline JS, you can always open its source code at first and only then fire it normally.
> 
> If page "bake" cookies/localStorage, then maybe use this as homepage: https://fiddle.jshell.net/9ngLtwx5/2/show/dark/ = simple adware should not go back/outside at used iframe/object/embed.



    The inline script userule suggested to me did work for windows adguard extension ||zoechip.com/|$inline-script,important

    it however did not work on Adguard IOS

    of which neither did this userule work on IOS either

    ||zoechip.com/|$csp=script-src 'self' 'unsafe-eval' http: https: data: blob: mediastream: filesystem:,important

    So for windows the redirect is blocked for IOS its not

comment.body:
> try check:
> 
> `view-source:https://www3.zoechip.com/` `view-source:http://zoechip.com/`
> 
> maybe their exist latest inline redirect script.
> 
> You can see if this manages to block line scripts on the home page after 200 ms delay:
> 
> ```
> ||zoechip.com/|$inline-script,important
> ```
> 
> With that said, I don't keep track of whether inline-script has been added for iOS, then may works only:
> 
> ```
> ||zoechip.com/|$csp=script-src 'self' 'unsafe-eval' http: https: data: blob: mediastream: filesystem:,important
> ```
> 
> if `csp=` works on iOS.
> 
> As the site by IP injects inline JS, you can always open its source code at first and only then fire it normally.
> 
> If page "bake" cookies/localStorage, then maybe use this as homepage: https://fiddle.jshell.net/9ngLtwx5/2/show/dark/ = simple adware should not go back/outside at used iframe/object/embed.

How do you guys figure out these userrules? i actually want to know i want to learn!

> > but this script does include the src= which i believe i remember is the sourse so its an external javascript file right?
> 
> Yes.
> 
> https://adguard.com/kb/general/ad-filtering/create-own-filters/#basic-rules-special-characters - maybe possible use wildcards if some letters/numers are stable in `src="..."`.
> 
> If nope then needed is learn regex and what regex is now suported at iOS:
> 
> https://adguard.com/kb/general/ad-filtering/create-own-filters/#regexp-support

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/124982114/9f08900d-facf-4e6d-adf4-ea321377d26d)


i dont comprehend this at all

i mean i guess 

    http://example.org/ad1.gif
    http://subdomain.example.org/ad1.gif
    https://ads.example.org:8000/
    
    
    All these blook because its first the address of the website instead of a part of the website and then the address of the website?
    
    
    
    and i guess these dont block because 
    
    
        http://ads.example.org.us/ad1.gif
    http://example.com/redirect/http://ads.example.org/
    
    
    Because its the part of the website you want to block being listed first before the address of the website? and the second one isnt blocking because while it is the address of the website listed first, with then somewhat of the website than added, its than also  with something else also added of the website which is fine but the address of the website added again at the end?
    
    Where i suppose it should be 
    
    
    http//example.org/us/ad1.gif      and the second one should be this?
    
    
    http://example.org/redirect/ads
    
    
    if this isnt correct than i have no idea why one list is blocked but other is not?

issue.title: zoechip.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.6

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers, Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www3.zoechip.com/movie/spirited-90331

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment> Hi so im going on zoechip3.org to try and watch a movie and even with my adguard up to date, latest version, and Mobil ads filter and base filter it still has ads on the site that i annoyingly have to keep closing only to open pop us which i have to close of those and if you click on the site it opens pop up tabs 

you literally have to face a couple pop up tabs to finally be able to use the site any help to this would be very appreciative 
3. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary> 

<!-- paste screenshot here [-->]
![9FF2E12D-81D9-490B-BD32-4AFDD2391307](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/124982114/c25f6f6e-ebe5-4057-9f41-4e813e605088)



</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary
![95476ADB-CCD6-4D17-83F5-5CEE56473FD7](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/124982114/24651f2c-81de-49ea-9afa-de81ac4976a1)
>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
> all this did is showed the inspect element html of the website without me needing to go into inspect element

There, to me, it's just about fooling the server that you are visiting a site for the first time on a given IP (some fraction of malware checks the IP to avoid loading a second time on the site).

---

> Krystian I dont know how to create my own filter rules i dont understand any of this i tried to and i dont get it so i need someone to do this for me, because im not capable

OK, if you have the desire you can try to learn what a wildcard is from other sources such as Adblock Plus specifications:

https://forum.adblockplus.org/viewtopic.php?t=54688

https://help.adblockplus.org/hc/en-us/articles/360062733293#anchors

"In short, an asterisk in a simple web filter replaces 1 or many characters - they allow any combination."

Mastering regexes rather well start with some beginner's courses and perhaps you will refresh it to yourself throughout your life e.g. problems with writing regexes so that it is not too loopy i.e. 'catastrophic regex'.

---

---

> and it saids safari cannot open page for its invalid on my iphone
>
> Also this link you keep sending

if you mean error 404 at `fiddle.net` then check https://jsfiddle.net/9ngLtwx5/2/

if you mean error about:
> "Refused to display '`https://www3.zoechip.com/`' in a frame because it set 'X-Frame-Options' to 'sameorigin'." 

then may needed is found similar WebExtension for iOS: 

https://github.com/ThomazPom/Moz-Ext-Ignore-X-Frame-Options
https://github.com/guilryder/chrome-extensions/tree/main/xframe_ignore

Unfortunately, I do not know for iOS such yet.

---

> Why is everytime i report miss ads on the adguard website and create a ticket that ticket is just added into the previous ones i also made on the same thread?

As you use the tool built into the AdGuard application what redirects to the dedicated online form "`https://reports.adguard.com/en/new_issue.html`", it is the expected behavior that the AdGuard Bot will paste this into the open submission as a comment.

As for this topic of yours:

>![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/35370833/3eab5441-fb36-48c3-bf58-c6a8905cf02a)

 maybe you don't understand the difference between the "create new issue" button and the "send comment" button.

comment.body:
I saw only the ad leftover on the video that is blocked. The update should be available in 2-3 hours.
After that time, try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

issue.title: The inline script or csp userule works on windows Adguard Extension but not Adguard IOS of which I have of premuim on my phone

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.6

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www3.zoechip.com/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>The inline script userule suggested to me did work for windows adguard extension ||zoechip.com/|$inline-script,important

it however did not work on Adguard IOS

of which neither did this userule work on IOS either

||zoechip.com/|$csp=script-src 'self' 'unsafe-eval' http: https: data: blob: mediastream: filesystem:,important

So for windows the redirect is blocked for IOS its not

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->
![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/124982114/73ec7173-71b2-45ab-8304-e48e99d421ab)


</details>
![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/124982114/1f82d7dd-ddd5-443b-8b4a-6059e62d4ea4)


<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>Also im trying to learn your adblock and the custom filters

So im gonna take a shot here would these filter rules of which right now are not put correctly therefore will not block

http://ads.example.org.us/ad1.gif
    http://example.com/redirect/http://ads.example.org/
    
    Would they block if they were typed this way instead?
    
    http://ads.example.org/us/ad1.gif
    http://example.com/http:ads.example.org/redirect
    
    or would it be http://ads.example.org/redirect?
    
    
    meaning there was never supposed to be a .com only a .org because in this example these are orginization websites?
    
    or is there an example.com commerical website and a example.org orginzation website
    
    of where if what i understand is correct the addresses of websites go first of http://example.com/http:ads.example.org/redirect?
    
    
    or would it actually be http://example.com/redirect
    
    and http://ads.example.org/redirect
    
    meaning they would be two seperate filter rules?



Im trying to understand this!


If im completely wrong on why these would not be blocked


than i dont comprehend your websites explanation on filter rules at all


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
csp is not supported on iOS in basic mode. You may try to enable Advanced Protection (it allows more advanced rules to work, unsure about $csp - @zloyden do you know?).

Sadly I do not understand your questions exactly regarding filter syntax. Please elaborate your rule suggestion and the question to them.

### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.6

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www3.zoechip.com/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>The inline script userule suggested to me did work for windows adguard extension ||zoechip.com/|$inline-script,important

it however did not work on Adguard IOS

of which neither did this userule work on IOS either

||zoechip.com/|$csp=script-src 'self' 'unsafe-eval' http: https: data: blob: mediastream: filesystem:,important

So for windows the redirect is blocked for IOS its not

2. Screenshots

So im gonna take a shot here would these filter rules of which right now are not put correctly therefore will not block

http://ads.example.org.us/ad1.gif
    http://example.com/redirect/http://ads.example.org/
    
    Would they block if they were typed this way instead?
    
    http://ads.example.org/us/ad1.gif

    or would it be http://ads.example.org/redirect?
    
    
    meaning there was never supposed to be a .com only a .org because in this example these are orginization websites?
    
    or is there an example.com commerical website and a example.org orginzation website
    
    of where if what i understand is correct the addresses of websites go first of http://example.com/http:ads.example.org/redirect?
    
    
    or would it actually be http://example.com/redirect
    
    and http://ads.example.org/redirect
    
    meaning they would be two seperate filter rules?



Im trying to understand this!


If im completely wrong on why these would not be blocked


than i dont comprehend your websites explanation on filter rules at all

comment.body:
Имелось в виду, что все нужно выключить по одному. Судя по скриншоту выше, проблема может быть с базовым фильтром. Попробуйте его выключить и проверить сайт. Если это поможет, сделайте следующее:
- Включите обратно Базовый фильтр
- Откройте журнал фильтрации и оставьте его в фоне
- Повторите проблему
- В журнале фильтрации сделайте два отдельных скриншота. Один с заблокированным запросами, другой с измененными. Кнопки `заблокированные`, `измененные` кликабельны
- Пришлите эти скриншоты сюда.

comment.body:
Hello,
It works fine on my end.
As I recall, by default filter lists are updated automatically every 48 hours, so I guess that might be the reason.

Could you please ask user to update filters manually?
To do it, it's necessary to click on the AdGuard icon and then on the update button (marked on the screenshot below).
<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/29142494/dac2979d-51b4-405c-af0a-87e40c5ffc8d)

</details>

### Внимание

Эта проблема решается с помощью расширения [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra).

Если вы используете AdGuard для Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включен в настройках программы.

Если вы используете браузерное расширение AdGuard, мы рекомендуем установить AdGuard Extra в дополнение к нему.

* [Установить в Chrome, Edge или другой браузер на основе Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установить в Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
Hi. Cannot reproduce with the same filter.
Which iOS version?
Does it crash when all filters are disabled?
Please try to disable all filters, and enable AdGuard filters one by one. You should to wait ~1 minute for applying each filter.

Also try to disable-enable content blockers in Safari settings and restart Safari, and check for filters update.
Do not close AdGuard window ~60 seconds, because iOS will breaks configuration process.

If no result - please contact support@adguard.com

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment> Hi so im going on zoechip3.org to try and watch a movie and even with my adguard up to date, latest version, and Mobil ads filter and base filter it still has ads on the site that i annoyingly have to keep closing only to open pop us which i have to close of those and if you click on the site it opens pop up tabs 

you literally have to face a couple pop up tabs to finally be able to use the site any help to this would be very appreciative 
3. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

comment.body:
> > all this did is showed the inspect element html of the website without me needing to go into inspect element
> 
> There, to me, it's just about fooling the server that you are visiting a site for the first time on a given IP (some fraction of malware checks the IP to avoid loading a second time on the site).
> 
> > Krystian I dont know how to create my own filter rules i dont understand any of this i tried to and i dont get it so i need someone to do this for me, because im not capable
> 
> OK, if you have the desire you can try to learn what a wildcard is from other sources such as Adblock Plus specifications:
> 
> https://forum.adblockplus.org/viewtopic.php?t=54688
> 
> https://help.adblockplus.org/hc/en-us/articles/360062733293#anchors
> 
> "In short, an asterisk in a simple web filter replaces 1 or many characters - they allow any combination."
> 
> Mastering regexes rather well start with some beginner's courses and perhaps you will refresh it to yourself throughout your life e.g. problems with writing regexes so that it is not too loopy i.e. 'catastrophic regex'.
> 
> > and it saids safari cannot open page for its invalid on my iphone
> > Also this link you keep sending
> 
> if you mean error 404 at `fiddle.net` then check https://jsfiddle.net/9ngLtwx5/2/
> 
> if you mean error about:
> 
> > "Refused to display '`https://www3.zoechip.com/`' in a frame because it set 'X-Frame-Options' to 'sameorigin'."
> 
> then may needed is found similar WebExtension for iOS:
> 
> https://github.com/ThomazPom/Moz-Ext-Ignore-X-Frame-Options https://github.com/guilryder/chrome-extensions/tree/main/xframe_ignore
> 
> Unfortunately, I do not know for iOS such yet.
> 
> _Here, I'll agree that it was my two mistakes (that I didn't check that the page defends against loading into an iframe/object/embed and that I didn't check that the link to the fullscreen version, however, expires after time hence the internal 404 error)._
> 
> > Why is everytime i report miss ads on the adguard website and create a ticket that ticket is just added into the previous ones i also made on the same thread?
> 
> As you use the tool built into the AdGuard application what redirects to the dedicated online form "`https://reports.adguard.com/en/new_issue.html`", it is the expected behavior that the AdGuard Bot will paste this into the open submission as a comment.
> 
> As for this topic of yours:
> 
> > ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35370833/259012064-3eab5441-fb36-48c3-bf58-c6a8905cf02a.png)
> 
> maybe you don't understand the difference between the "create new issue" button and the "send comment" button.

Again I barely understand anything your saying

So please do not ask me to create a userrule or an ad filter I dont comprehend this


Please just get this resolved for me

However, it does not work on bihann.com. A blank screen appears when I tap on it. > > I checked the AdGuard filter to see if there was any difference between nehannn.com and bihann.com. As a result, I found the following rules only for nehannn.com. issue.title: Zoechip turns out my fix is only a temporary solution
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.6

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers, Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www3.zoechip.com/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>So I thought I had this resolved turns out it was only a temporary solution the website Zoechip has an imbeded head meta tag href link of which right now its https://zkwl.zwmvyzyrlvzew.top/kbwaazlzkwjla/abqaj

before that it was https://krze.klrqqylrzzzj.top/kzzeenqvnqjww/abqaj

the only connection both url have is the .top/abqaj everything else is different.

And no matter which one i block of these rules ||zwmvyzyrlvzew.top^$important  klrqqylrzzzj.top^$important   ||qnlranvabrnq.top^$important

A new one just gets added into the head meta tag section of the html making the rule no longer apply

I need help please!!!!
3. Screenshots

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
